title: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
description: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
OB: When attempting to open a file in the Editor Management system with a different type of editor, if the file is already open, the action has no effect.
EB: Reproduce the steps in this scenario: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types. The expected behavior is that a new editor should be opened for the file, as the editor type is different.
SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Open the ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example with an XML file as the default. 2. Create a new basic project. 3. Create a new file named test.xml. 4. In the Navigator, select test.xml. 5. Choose 'Open With...' and select 'Default Text Editor'. Observe that nothing happens and the scripted resource editor example is reactivated.
